foodapp.title: Blackberry Ginger Iced Green Tea
foodapp.ingredients:
4 green tea bags, 
4 cups hot water,
2 cups fresh blackberries,
¾ cup frozen pineapple chunks,
½ lime, juiced,
1 Tbsp fresh ginger,
1 Tbsp maple syrup, 
¼ cup fresh mint leaves,
½ lime, sliced, ice cubes
foodapp.preparation:
Add the green tea to the hot water and let it steep until it cools down completely. To a blender, add the blackberries, frozen pineapple, lime, ginger, and maple syrup. Blend until smooth. Strain the blended blackberry mixture through a sieve to remove the seeds. To assemble, first divide the puréed blackberry mixture between the glasses, followed by mint, lime slice cubes, and finish with the cooled green tea.
Stir and add more sweetener to taste. Garnish and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Mango Turmeric Lassi
foodapp.ingredients:
2 soft Medjool dates, pits removed, 
2½ cups frozen mango chunks, 
2 cups unsweetened soy yogurt, 
¾ cup unsweetened soy milk,
½ Tbsp fresh ginger,
½ tsp ground turmeric,
1 pinch of ground black pepper,
¼ lemon, juiced
foodapp.preparation:
Add all the ingredients to a blender and blend until smooth.
Pour into glasses and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Brown Sugar Matcha Bubble Tea
foodapp.ingredients:
2 Tbsp brown sugar,
2 Tbsp boiling water,
½ cup quick-cooking tapioca pearls,
2 tsp matcha powder,
½ cup hot water, 
1 tsp pure vanilla extract
1 cup ice cubes
2½ cups barista oat milk
foodapp.preparation:
Add the brown sugar and boiling water to a bowl. Stir vigorously until the sugar has dissolved.
In a saucepan, cook the tapioca pearls according to the package instructions. For us, this took about 5 minutes.
Drain the tapioca pearls, rinse under cold water, and transfer to the brown sugar syrup jar. Give it a mix.
Sift the matcha powder into a bowl. Then add the hot water. Use a matcha whisk* to whisk until there’s a foam layer on top of the matcha.
Add the vanilla extract to the matcha mixture and whisk again until combined.
Divide the brown sugar pearls between the glasses, top with the ice cubes, milk, and lastly the matcha. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Layered Chocolate Raspberry Mousse
foodapp.ingredients:
300 g silken tofu, drained
200g melted dark chocolate,
½ tsp pure vanilla extract,
¼ tsp ground cardamom,
¼ cup granulated sugar, 
4 cups fresh raspberries, 
½ cup vegan whipping cream,
1 Tbsp cream stabilizer
foodapp.preparation:
To a food processor, add the tofu, melted chocolate, vanilla, cardamom, and half the sugar. Blend until smooth.
To each of the serving glasses, add ¼ cup of raspberries. Lightly mash the raspberries with the back of a spoon or tamper.
Reserve about ¼ of the blended chocolate mixture in a bowl. Divide the remaining between your glasses over the mashed raspberries. Place the glasses in the fridge while preparing the next layer.
To a large bowl, add the whipping cream, cream stabilizer, and remaining sugar. Whip on medium-high with an electric hand mixer for about 7 minutes, or until stiff peaks form. Reserve some of the whipped cream as a topping if desired.
Then add the reserved blended chocolate mixture to the remaining whipped cream and gently fold together.
Remove the cups from the fridge and add some raspberries (or other berries) as the next layer.
Then divide this whipped chocolate mousse between the glasses.
Top with the reserved whipped cream and any desired garnishes. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Coconut Mango Passion Fruit Trifle
foodapp.ingredients:
¾ cup passion fruit pulp,
½ cup frozen mango chunks,
2 tsp granulated sugar,
Coconut whip,
1⅓ cups coconut cream,
2 Tbsp powdered sugar
1 tsp pure vanilla extract,
165g Biscoff speculoos cookies,
2 Tbsp unsalted vegan butter
foodapp.preparation:
Place a sieve over a saucepan and strain out the passion fruit seeds. Set the seeds aside if desired, to use for garnish.
With the saucepan over medium-high heat, add the mango and sugar. Cook at a gentle simmer for 4 minutes, until slightly thickened. Set aside to cool.
In a large bowl, use an electric hand mixer to whip the coconut cream* for a few minutes. Then add the sugar and vanilla and whip again.
Add the cookies and butter to a food processor and blend into a crumb. Then add 2 Tbsp of the cookie crumbs to each serving glass and press down to form a crust on the bottom.
In the now-empty food processor, blend the mango mixture until puréed.
Spoon a heaping ¼ cup of the coconut whipping cream on top of the cookie layer, followed by a tablespoon of the passion fruit mixture. Garnish as desired, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: High Protein Vegan Pancakes
foodapp.ingredients:
300g silken tofu,
1½cups unsweetened milk, 
2Tbsp maple syrup,
2tsp pure vanilla extract,
2tsp lemon juice,
3½cups flour, 
2tsp baking powder,
1tsp baking soda,
1tsp ground cinnamon,
¼tsp salt,
1Tbsp vegetable oil,
1cup greek yogurt,
1cup mixed fresh berries
foodapp.preparation:
To a blender, add the tofu, pea milk, maple syrup, vanilla, and lemon juice. Blend until smooth.
To a large bowl, add the spelt flour, baking powder, baking soda, cinnamon, and salt. Mix well. Then add the wet ingredients from the blender. Mix until just combined, but be careful not to over-mix. If the mixture is too thick, add a splash of plant milk to thin it out a touch.
Heat a non-stick crêpe pan on medium-high heat and use a bit of oil to lightly grease the pan. Use a ¼ measuring cup to pour the batter onto the pan. Cook for 2 minutes on each side, or until golden. Continue with the leftover batter.
Top with yogurt, nuts, berries, and maple syrup if desired, and enjoy.

foodapp.title: Miso Sesame Soba Noodles
foodapp.ingredients:
⅓ cup rice vinegar
¼ cup tahini
3 Tbsp white miso paste
2 Tbsp dark soy sauce 
2 cloves garlic, 
2 tsp sesame oil,
2 tsp maple syrup,
1 tsp freshly grated ginger,
180 g dry soba noodles,
1 tsp sesame oil,
140 g shiitake mushrooms, 
1½ cups edamame beans,
1 avocado, 
6 small raw radishes, 
1 stalk green onion, 
1 Tbsp toasted sesame seeds
foodapp.preparation:
In a mason jar, mix together the rice vinegar*, tahini, miso paste, soy sauce, garlic, sesame oil, maple syrup, and ginger.
In a saucepan, cook the soba noodles according to the package instructions, then drain. For us, this took about 5 minutes.
Meanwhile, add the oil to a large pan on high heat. When hot, add in the mushrooms and edamame beans and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Then add the soba noodles, and dressing. Let everything heat through.
Divide the noodles between your bowls, and top with sliced avocado, radishes, green onions, and sesame seeds. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Oatmeal with Caramelized Pear
foodapp.ingredients:
1 cup rolled oats 
2 cups of soy milk 
1 tsp ground cinnamon,
½ tsp ground ginger,
¼ tsp ground cloves,
⅛ tsp ground allspice,
2 Tbsp ground flaxseeds,
2 tsp maple syrup,
1 tsp blackstrap molasses,
1 pear, 
2 tsp maple syrup
foodapp.preparation:
To a saucepan, add the oats, milk, cinnamon, ginger, cloves, and allspice. Bring to a gentle boil, then reduce to a simmer for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Meanwhile, to a medium pan on medium-high heat, add the sliced pear and the maple syrup. Let the pear caramelize for about 4 minutes while stirring and flipping the pear slices occasionally. Take off the heat.
To the saucepan of oatmeal, add the flaxseeds, maple syrup, and molasses and let it cook for another 1 - 2 minutes. Add more milk if you prefer a thinner consistency.
Divide the oatmeal, caramelized pear, yogurt, and pecans between the bowls. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Peppermint Mocha
foodapp.ingredients:
1 Tbsp granulated sugar,
2 tsp cocoa powder,
1 tsp instant coffee granules,
6 g dark chocolate, 
1 tsp peppermint candies, finely chopped,
½ cup boiling water,
2 cups barista oat milk
foodapp.preparation:
In a jar, mix the sugar, cocoa powder, instant coffee, chocolate, and peppermint*.
Mix 1½ Tbsp of the powdered mix with ¼ cup (60 mL) of boiling water in each mug and stir to dissolve.
Then add 1 cup (240 mL) hot milk per mug and stir.
Top with whipped cream, chocolate shavings, and peppermint pieces if desired. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Spicy Vegan Chipotle Fajitas
foodapp.ingredients:
1 Tbsp (15 mL) vegetable oil
1 medium onion, sliced
3 cloves garlic, thinly sliced
½ tsp salt
3 bell peppers , sliced
1½ cups (252 g) mock "chicken" pieces, torn into shreds 
2 tsp ground cumin,
1 tsp dried oregano,
1 tsp paprika powder,
½ tsp chili powder,
¼ tsp ground black pepper,
12 small soft tortillas,
3 Tbsp peppers in adobo sauce,
1 avocado,  
⅔ cup salsa,
½ cup shredded red cabbage, 
1 lime
foodapp.preparation:
Add the oil to a large pan on medium-high heat. When hot, add the onion, garlic, and salt, and let cook for 4 - 5 minutes*. Meanwhile, slice the bell peppers.
Then add the bell peppers, mock "chicken", and spices. Cook for 5 minutes, or until the bell peppers have softened but are still crunchy. Add splashes of water as needed to deglaze the pan.
Meanwhile, heat a separate large pan on medium-high heat, and place the tortillas on top in a single layer. Toast for a few seconds on each side, until golden.
Returning to the bell peppers, add the diced chipotle sauce**. Cook for an extra 2 minutes.
To assemble the fajitas, top the tortillas with the bell pepper mixture and your desired toppings. Squeeze some fresh lime juice over top, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Coconut & Tofu Thai Red Curry
foodapp.ingredients:
½ Tbsp vegetable oil
3 medium shallots, 
2 cloves garlic, 
2 medium potatoes, 
3 Tbsp Thai red curry paste 
1¼ cups water
1 cup uncooked basmati rice 
350 g pre-seasoned tofu strips,
2 red bell peppers, 
1 small broccoli,
1⅔ cups canned full-fat coconut milk 
1 Tbsp soy sauce,  
1 tsp sambal oelek,  
⅓ cup roasted cashews,
foodapp.preparation:
In a large pot on high heat, add the oil and sauté the shallots for about 5 minutes, or until lightly golden. Add splashes of water as needed to de-glaze the pan.
Add the garlic and cook for another 2 minutes.
Add the potatoes and curry paste, and cook for 1 - 2 minutes.
Then add the water to the pot. Bring to a boil, then reduce to a simmer, and cover with a lid. Simmer for 15 minutes.
Meanwhile, cook the rice according to package directions.
Add the remaining ingredients to the pot and cook for about 6 - 8 minutes, or until the veggies are cooked to desired tenderness.
Serve with the rice, and top with cashews for crunch. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Lemon Yogurt Parfait
foodapp.ingredients:
¼ cup greek-style yogurt,
1 Tbsp cashew butter,
½ tsp maple syrup,
¼ tsp lemon zest,
⅛ tsp pure vanilla extract,
1 cookie,
¼ cup fresh berries
foodapp.preparation:
In a small bowl, combine the yogurt, cashew butter, maple syrup, lemon zest, and vanilla extract.
Crumble half the digestive biscuit into the bottom of a cup, top with half of the yogurt mixture, crumble the other half of the biscuit over that, then finish with the remaining yogurt.
Add the fruit and you're good to go!

foodapp.title: Warm Pearl Couscous Salad
foodapp.ingredients:
1 cup uncooked pearl couscous,
2 tsp olive oil,
2 cups cooked chickpeas, 
2 cups cherry tomato, 
½ tsp salt,
¼ tsp ground black pepper,
½ cucumber, 
¼ cup sliced black olives,
3 Tbsp fresh mint leaves,
2 Tbsp fresh basil, 
2 Tbsp fresh parsley, 
¼ cup roasted almonds, 
3 Tbsp extra virgin olive oil,
3 Tbsp red wine vinegar, 
½ lemon, 
¼ tsp paprika powder
foodapp.preparation:
Cook the couscous according to the package instructions, then drain.
Meanwhile, to a medium pan on medium-high heat, add the oil, chickpeas, tomatoes, salt, and pepper. Cook for about 5 - 7 minutes, stirring occasionally. Remove from the heat.
In a small bowl, mix together the ingredients for the dressing.
To a large bowl, add the drained couscous, tomato and chickpea mixture, cucumber slices, olives, and fresh herbs. Add the dressing, toss to combine, spinkle over the almonds, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Raspberry Lemonade Smoothie Bowl
foodapp.ingredients:
1½cups frozen raspberries,
1frozen banana,
1lemon, 
½cup soy yogurt,
½cup roasted cashews,
¼cup soy milk,
1Tbsp agave syrup,
fresh fruit,
hemp seeds,
lemon zest,
vegan granola
foodapp.preparation:
Add all ingredients to a high-speed blender and blend until smooth.
Taste test. The raspberries are tart and the lemon is sour. If you feel it's needed, add more syrup to cut through the tartness.
Divide into bowls and add desired toppings. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Oyster Mushroom Curry Salad Sandwich
foodapp.ingredients:
1 tsp olive oil,
1 clove garlic, 
½ medium shallot, 
2 cups oyster mushrooms,
⅛ tsp salt,
½ tsp cumin,
½ tsp coriander,
¼ tsp ginger,
⅛ tsp black pepper,
½ cup canned pineapple, 
2 Tbsp vegan mayonnaise,
2 Tbsp soy yogurt,
1 tsp curry powder,
1 tsp dijon mustard,
4 slices wheat bread, 
2 romaine lettuce leaves, 
1 tomato, 
1 stalk green onion
foodapp.preparation:
Heat a medium pan over medium-high heat. Add the oil, garlic, and shallot. Cook for 2 - 3 minutes. Using your hands, peel the mushrooms into small strips, and add them to the pan along with the salt. Cook, while stirring occasionally for 3 minutes.
Next, add the cumin, coriander, ginger, and pepper, and cook for another 3 minutes. By now, the liquid from the mushrooms should have evaporated. Transfer the mixture to a bowl.
To the same bowl, add the pineapple, mayo, yogurt, curry powder, and mustard. Stir to combine.
To assemble the sandwich, begin with a slice of your favourite bread. Layer it with lettuce, tomato slices, the mushroom curry mixture, and top it with some green onions. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Oven Roasted Sweet Potato & Tofu Veggie Skewers
foodapp.ingredients:
450 g firm tofu, 
1 tsp olive oil,
1 Tbsp cornstarch,
1 tsp garlic powder,
½ tsp salt,
¼ tsp black pepper,
2 Tbsp olive oil,
½ lemon,
¼ tsp oregano,
¼ tsp thyme,
¼ tsp basil,
¼ tsp salt,
⅛ tsp black pepper,
1 yellow bell pepper, 
1 red bell pepper, 
1 large red onion, 
1 large sweet potato, 
½ medium zucchini, 
21 cherry tomatoes
foodapp.preparation:
Soak about 20 - 25 wooden 7 inch (18 cm) skewers in a shallow dish of water for about 15 minutes. This will prevent the skewers from burning when they are baking. Preheat the oven to 390°F (200°C).
Cut the tofu into 1 inch (2 cm) bite-sized squares that are rather thin, but not too thin that they fall apart when threading through the skewer. If cut too thick, they won't crisp up as nicely.
To a large shallow dish, add the tofu pieces, drizzle over the olive oil, and gently toss to coat. Then add the cornstarch, garlic powder, salt, and pepper, and give it another gentle toss.
To a medium bowl, add the ingredients for the marinade, and give it a mix.
Thread the tofu on the skewers along with the chopped veggies. Repeat until the skewer is filled up, and finish it with a cherry tomato on top.
Brush the marinade over the skewers, and place the skewers onto a wire rack. Place the rack into the centre of the oven, with a baking tray underneath to catch any liquid that drips off.
Bake in the oven for 25 - 30 minutes, or until the veggies are cooked to your liking. These skewers are delicious on their own, but we definitely recommend enjoying them together with our vegan tzatziki recipe! Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Peach Thyme Iced Tea
foodapp.ingredients:
4 cups boiling water,
4 white tea bags, 
3 lemons, 
6 ripe peaches, 
10 fresh thyme,
1 cup water,
⅓ cup maple syrup,
1½ cups ice cubes,
½ peach, 
4 fresh thyme
foodapp.preparation:
To a large jar, add the boiled water and tea bags, and let it steep for 8 - 10 minutes. Then remove the tea bags and let cool off. Once cooled, stir in the lemon juice.
To a saucepan, add the peaches, thyme, water, and maple syrup.
Bring to a boil, then reduce to a gentle simmer and cook uncovered for about 20 minutes, stirring occasionally. Once softened, mash the peaches using the back of a spatula or tamper.
Place a sieve over a bowl and strain through the peach mixture. Using the back of a spoon, press out as much liquid from the mixture into the bowl as possible*. Let this cool off completely.
To assemble the drinks, divide the ice cubes between your glasses. Then pour one part of peach syrup to two parts of the cooled lemon tea mixture into your cups. Stir, garnish, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Vegan Breakfast Waffles
foodapp.ingredients:
1½cups soy milk,
1Tbsp apple cider vinegar,
2cups whole wheat flour,
⅓cup applesauce,
2tsp baking powder,
1tsp ground cinnamon,
1tsp pure vanilla extract,
½tsp salt
foodapp.preparation:
To a large bowl, add the milk and vinegar, mix, and let this rest for 5 minutes. The milk will start to slightly curdle, and this is normal.
Heat the waffle maker. Then, returning to the bowl, add the flour, applesauce, baking powder, cinnamon, vanilla, and salt, then mix until just combined.
Brush the waffle pan with some oil. Add a few spoonfuls of the waffle batter until the element is filled near to the top. Gently close the lid, and let it cook for 4 - 5 minutes, or until golden. Repeat this with the remaining batter.
Add desired toppings to your waffles, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Crunchy Almond & Mango Granola
foodapp.ingredients:
2½cups rolled oats,
1cup puffed quinoa, 
½cup raw almonds,
½cup shredded coconut,
½cup roasted pumpkin seeds, 
¼cup brown sugar,
½tsp cinnamon,
¼cup vegetable oil,
¼cup maple syrup,
¼cup almond butter,
1tsp pure vanilla extract,
¾tsp salt,
2Tbsp hemp seeds,
½cup dried mango
foodapp.preparation:
Preheat the oven to 320°F (160°C). To a large bowl, add the oats, puffed quinoa, almonds, coconut, pumpkin seeds, brown sugar, and cinnamon, and give it a stir.
To a separate medium bowl, add the oil, syrup, almond butter, vanilla, and salt. Whisk until it's all combined into a smooth caramel-like sauce.
Pour this wet mix over the dry mix, and stir until coated.
Transfer to a large lined baking tray and spread it out. Bake on the centre rack of the oven for 30 minutes, or until lightly golden, stopping stir once halfway.
Remove from the oven and allow it to cool. It continues to harden as it cools. Add the hemp seeds and dried mango, and toss.
When completely cooled, transfer the granola to a storage container. Enjoy with fruit, and yogurt or milk for breakfast, or as a snack!

foodapp.title: Double Tomato Bruschetta with Balsamic Reduction
foodapp.ingredients:
1½ cups (270 g) cherry tomatoes, cut into quarters 
½ cup (12 g) fresh basil, thinly sliced
¼ cup sun-dried tomatoes in oil,
1 tsp oil from sun-dried tomatoes, 
½ Tbsp capers, 
2 cloves garlic,
1 tsp onion powder, 
¼ tsp salt,
¼ tsp black pepper,
½ cup balsamic vinegar,
1 large baguette, 
1 Tbsp oil from sun-dried tomatoes
foodapp.preparation:
In a bowl, combine the chopped tomatoes, basil, sun-dried tomatoes and oil, capers, garlic, onion powder, salt, and pepper. Set aside to allow the flavours to meld.
Make the balsamic reduction* by pouring the balsamic vinegar in a saucepan. Cook uncovered at a gentle boil until the volume reduces by about a quarter, which will take about 5 - 10 minutes.
For the grilled toasts, brush both sides of the bread with the sun-dried tomato oil and toast on a frying pan on high heat, or in the oven on broil, until the edges are golden.
Serve the bruschetta with the toasted bread, drizzle over a very small amount of the balsamic reduction, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Spicy Miso Sesame Ramen
foodapp.ingredients:
1½ Tbsp sesame paste,
1 Tbsp white miso paste,
2 tsp doubanjiang chili bean paste,
¼ cup almond milk,
1 shallot, 
2 cloves garlic, 
½ tsp grated ginger,
50 g shiitake mushrooms,
1 Tbsp vegetable oil,
2 cups vegetable stock,
4 heads Shanghai bok choy, 
150 g fried tofu puffs,
1 tsp sesame oil,
360 g udon noodles,
½ carrot, 
½ cup bean sprouts
foodapp.preparation:
In a small bowl, mix the Asian sesame paste, miso paste, bean paste, and almond milk.
Fry the shallot, garlic, ginger, and shiitake in oil in sauté pan on medium-high for 5 - 7 minutes.
Add the stock and miso mixture to the pot. Bring to a boil, reduce to a simmer, and cook uncovered for 5 - 7 minutes.
In the last 30 seconds add bok choy, tofu, and sesame oil.
Meanwhile, cook the noodles separately for 30 seconds, or according to the package instruction. Drain and add to the bowls.
Pour the soup over the noodles and garnish with desired toppings. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Grilled Red Pepper Pesto Pasta
foodapp.ingredients:
1 Tbsp olive oil,  
2 red bell peppers, 
1 orange bell pepper, 
¼ tsp salt, 
⅛ tsp ground black pepper, 
4 cloves of garlic, 
1 medium zucchini, 
14.1 oz dry spaghetti pasta,
¼ cup sun-dried tomatoes in oil, 
¼ cup roasted walnuts,
1½ cups green peas
foodapp.preparation:
Add half the oil to a large pan on high heat. When hot, add the bell peppers in a single layer and sprinkle a bit of salt and pepper over top. Cook until the skin begins to blister, and then flip to cook on the other side*.
When the bell peppers are cooked through and blistered on both sides, push them to the side of the pan, add a small bit more oil, and cook the garlic until lightly golden, about 2 - 3 minutes. Transfer both the bell pepper and garlic to a food processor or blender.
Return the same pan to the heat, and add more oil. When hot, cook the zucchini. Sprinkle over some salt and pepper, and try not to disturb the zucchini as it cooks, and give a flip only when golden. Meanwhile, cook the pasta in a large pot of salted boiling water.
Returning to the food processor, add in the sun-dried tomato, and walnuts. Blend until smooth, but some small chunks can remain, if desired.
In the last two minutes of the pasta cooking, add the peas to the cooking water. When the pasta is al dente, drain. Then return the drained pasta to the pot. Add the cooked zucchini and blended red bell pepper mixture to the pot. Toss everything to coat.
One heated through, serve while hot. Garnish if desired, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Chickpea Omelette Sandwich
foodapp.ingredients:
1 Tbsp ground flaxseeds
3 Tbsp water,
½ cup chickpea flour,
½ cup soy milk,
1 Tbsp nutritional yeast flakes,
¼ tsp onion powder,
¼ tsp garlic powder,
¼ tsp kala namak,
¼ tsp salt,
⅛ tsp black pepper,
½ red bell pepper,
1 red onion, 
1 Tbsp olive oil, 
6 slices of wheat bread,
2 tsp olive oil,
3 Tbsp mayonnaise,
1 cup romaine lettuce,
1 tomato, 
1 avocado
foodapp.preparation:
In a large bowl, mix together the ground flaxseeds and water. Set aside for 5 minutes to gel.
Then add the chickpea flour, milk, nutritional yeast, onion powder, garlic powder, kala namak, salt, pepper, and half of the chopped bell pepper and red onions. Mix until well combined.
Heat a large pan or skillet over medium-high heat and add some of the olive oil. Working in batches, add about two tablespoons of the omelette mixture to create a thin little omelette.
When golden on the bottom, flip the omelettes over and cook on the other side. Repeat this process until you've finished the batter.
Toast the bread by brushing some olive oil on both sides of the slices. Heat a skillet over medium-high heat, and toast the bread for 2 minutes on each side, until crispy and golden.
Assemble the sandwich by spreading some mayonnaise on each slice. Top with lettuce, the omelette, tomato slices, avocado, the remaining raw bell pepper and onions. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Raspberry Rose Chocolate Bark
foodapp.ingredients:
3 Tbsp roasted pistachios, 
¼ cup raspberries,
2 Tbsp coconut flakes,
2 Tbsp pineapple pieces,
1 Tbsp dried red rose petals, 
2 tsp hemp seeds,
400 g dark chocolate
foodapp.preparation:
Prepare and have at-the-ready your desired toppings: the pistachios, dried raspberries, coconut flakes, hemp seeds, candied pineapple, and rose petals. Line a baking tray with parchment paper.
Fill a saucepan one-quarter full with water, and bring to a gentle boil. Place a large heat-safe bowl on top of the pan and add the chocolate. The heat from the bowl will melt the chocolate. Stir throughout.
Once melted, remove the bowl from the stove (be careful as the bowl will be hot). Pour the melted chocolate onto the baking tray.
Use the back of a rubber spatula to spread the chocolate out into a thin layer, about ½ cm thick.
Sprinkle over top all of the toppings. Then use the back of a spoon to gently press down the pieces into the chocolate. Place the chocolate bark in the fridge for at least 1 hour to harden.
Once solid, let slightly soften at room temperature for a minute before cutting to avoid it snapping in other places. Cut into your desired shapes and sizes. Enjoy!

foodapp.title: Tea-Infused Chocolate Mousse
foodapp.ingredients:
1 cup aquafaba,
2 bags flavored tea,
175 g dairy-free dark chocolate,
lemon zest,
pomegranate seeds
foodapp.preparation:
Add the aquafaba and tea bags* to a saucepan over medium-high heat. Remove the pan from the heat just before it starts to simmer.
Make sure your bowl and electric hand mixer are grease-free. Transfer the liquid and tea bags to a large bowl to cool. When cooled, remove the tea bags.
Melt the chocolate using a microwave or on the stove, using a double boiler. Let the chocolate cool off a bit.
Beat the cooled aquafaba until stiff peaks are formed, this should take around 6 - 8 minutes.
In a slow and steady stream, add the melted chocolate to the aquafaba, carefully folding with a rubber spatula. Be careful not to over-mix, as the mousse can lose its air.
Scoop the mixture into some glass jars and refrigerate for at least 1 hour or overnight.
When ready to serve, top with your desired garnish, and enjoy!

foodapp.title: Coconut Whip
foodapp.ingredients:
1⅓ cups coconut cream,
2 Tbsp powdered sugar,
1 tsp pure vanilla extract
foodapp.preparation:
Place the coconut milk can upside-down in the refrigerator for at least 5 hours, but best if left in the fridge overnight to allow the liquid to separate from the fat. Refrigerate a large bowl together with the whisks of your electric hand mixer for at least 10 minutes to cool.
Gently turn the can back right-side-up, and open the can. Pour out the liquid layer on the top, and save this for a future smoothie or curry. Using a spoon, scoop out the solid white coconut fat into a large bowl.
Whip the coconut cream for 3 - 4 minutes.
Then add in the icing sugar and vanilla, and whip again for an additional minute.
Use the coconut whip to top brownies, fruit crumbles, watermelon pizza, or as a topping on your favorite hot chocolate.
